Greetings to all my dear friends,
Today we're going to talk about an important and sensitive topic. Unfortunately, some people still have a tendency to engage in dangerous behaviors like drunk driving or drug use, behaviors that are dangerous not only to themselves but also to others.
While these behaviors may seem exciting at first, they can actually lead to serious accidents that can have many consequences for you and others.

Together, we can build a healthy and safe society. Thank you for your attention.

It's not easy to encourage people to engage in dangerous behavior, but sometimes we need to be reminded that our decisions have consequences, which is why today we want to talk about drunk driving and drug use.
There is no excuse for this behavior, you are not only putting yourself in danger, but also other road users, and every year many people lose their lives or are seriously injured in accidents caused by people who have driven under the influence of alcohol or drugs.
We urge you to never drive while intoxicated or under the influence of drugs, and there is always an alternative: take public transportation, take a taxi, or ask someone who is sober to drive you.

My dear friends,
We want to look at a very important topic - dangerous behavior that can endanger not only your life, but the lives of other people.
We are aware that many people choose to behave this way for various reasons - they may feel lonely, stressed, or simply want to relax.
Drunk driving can lead to traffic accidents that can be fatal, and drug use can also lead to serious health problems, and in some cases, death.
There are many other ways to relax and have fun without endangering yourself or others. You can hang out with friends, go out in nature, play sports or do other activities that you enjoy.
If you do decide to behave in this way, please consider the consequences and do not endanger the lives of others. Your life and the lives of others are precious and should not be put in danger.
Together we can work to create a safer and healthier society for all of us.
